availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, druggist. Native of Prussia. Married to Martha White Preissler in Jefferson County, Kentucky, on August 19, 1846. Father of Henry Preissler, Theodore Preissler, John Preissler, and Julius Preissler. Graduate of the University of Breslau in Warsaw, Poland, in 1831. Immigrated to the United States on October 2, 1834. Druggist in Louisville, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned two enslaved person in Louisville in 1850. Druggist in Louisville in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Louisville in 1860. Druggist in Louisville in 1861. Druggist in Louisville in 1865.
